itemSummaries.title: Vintage Casio BP-1B Blood Pressure Monitor Men’s Digital Watch Module 2187 JDM
itemSummaries.shortDescription: Offered here is a rare and highly collectible vintage Casio BP-1B digital blood pressure monitor wristwatch, equipped with module 2187. Released in 2001, this was one of Casio’s most advanced health-f...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Offered here is a rare and highly collectible vintage Casio BP-1B digital blood pressure monitor wristwatch, equipped with module 2187. Released in 2001, this was one of Casio’s most advanced health-focused watches, made exclusively for the Japanese domestic market (JDM).


Unlike earlier BP models like the BP-100 (1992), the BP-1B featured enhanced health monitoring and was designed to interface via infrared (IR) with a companion calibration base unit—a unique innovation that allowed the transfer of calibration data directly to the watch, ensuring highly accurate blood pressure readings. This functionality sets it apart as one of Casio’s most ambitious and forward-thinking digital watches of its era.


Key Features:

• Model: Casio BP-1B

• Module: 2187

• Year of Release: 2001

• Functionality: Fully functional; all features including the blood pressure sensor, backlight, and sound are working perfectly

• Display: Clear digital readout with day, date, and time

• Strap: Original stainless steel band with Casio-signed clasp

• Condition: Good physical condition with light signs of use; please refer to photos for the most accurate representation

• Backlight & Sound: Fully operational

• Origin: Made in Japan – JDM-only release

• Collectibility: Rare and desirable for Casio and tech watch collectors


This is a standout piece from Casio’s health-tech legacy and a conversation-starting addition to any collection.


Ships carefully.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Up for sale is a striking vintage Longines Wittnauer wristwatch from the 1960s, showcasing elegant mid-century styling and Swiss-made mechanical precision.


This classic tank-style timepiece features a rectangular case crafted in 10K gold-filled metal, manufactured by the Star Watch Case Company. The inside of the case back is fully signed:


“LONGINES – WITTNAUER WATCH CO. INC. / GENEVA – MONTREAL / STAR W.C. CO. / 10K GOLDFILLED / 1137-370”

with the internal case serial number 552969 stamped below.


The original black dial is accented by applied gold-tone hour markers and dauphine-style hands. The iconic Longines winged hourglass logo is printed beneath the 12 o’clock position, creating a clean and refined aesthetic.


Inside, the watch is powered by a hand-wound Swiss movement stamped LONGINES WATCH CO. SWISS / SEVENTEEN 17 JEWELS / UNADJUSTED / 13707784. The movement is running smoothly and has been visually inspected to be in excellent cosmetic condition.


Key Features:

• Brand: Longines Wittnauer

• Production Era: 1960s

• Case Dimensions: 24mm width (excluding crown) x 37mm lug-to-lug

• Case Material: 10K Gold-Filled (marked with star hallmark on exterior and interior)

• Dial: Original black lacquer dial

• Movement: Manual wind Swiss movement, 17 jewels, Longines-stamped (serial 13707784)

• Condition: Running and keeping time; light vintage wear consistent with age (see photos)

• Strap: New genuine leather strap in black (non-original)


This piece is an excellent example of Longines’ craftsmanship during the golden age of wristwatch design. A perfect addition to any vintage watch collection or a refined statement piece for regular wear.


Please review all photos carefully for the best indication of condition. Feel free to message with any questions or requests for more images.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a vintage Texswiss Compass Watch in exceptional, nearly new condition. This Swiss-made timepiece features a rugged, tactical design complete with an integrated analog compass, a rotating bezel, and a highly legible dial with luminous hands and indices. The quartz movement is reliable and currently running with a brand-new battery, keeping accurate time.


The case and band with full links are in outstanding condition, showing minimal if any signs of wear. The compass watch head can be swiveled out for viewing. This model is shockproof, waterproof to 100M (10 ATM), and built with all stainless steel components for durability.


Brand History:

Texswiss was a niche Swiss watchmaker known for producing durable and function-forward timepieces during the late 20th century. Marketed in the U.S. through the Atlantic Eastern Corporation, Texswiss watches gained popularity for their reliability, affordability, and rugged aesthetics—especially models like this compass-equipped sport watch that catered to adventurers, outdoor enthusiasts, and tactical users.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Oyster WW2 Military Men’s Manual Watch - Serviced & Running
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolex-built Oyster from the World War II era. Produced circa 1944–1945, this timepiece boasts an all-original design with military styl...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolex-built Oyster from the World War II era. Produced circa 1944–1945, this timepiece boasts an all-original design with military styling and Rolex’s legendary engineering, making it a perfect addition for collectors and vintage watch enthusiasts.



Key Features:

• Brand: Oyster Watch Co. (Rolex)

• Production Year: Circa 1944–1945 (based on serial number 364255)

• Movement: Original Rolex Caliber 59, 17 Jewels (manual wind)

• Case Size: 30mm (excluding crown)

• Dial: Original cream-tone dial with bold Arabic numerals and heat-blued steel hands

• Bracelet: Brand new high-end black leather strap

• Caseback Reference (Exterior): 364255 (serial number)

• Caseback Reference (Interior): 4453 (Rolex case reference)

• Inner Caseback Markings: Stamped “Oyster Watch Co. Geneva–Swiss,” “Patented in All Countries,” and “R.W.C. LTD”



Condition Notes:


This WW2-era watch is in excellent vintage condition. The dial features a beautiful naturally aged patina consistent with its age. The hands are original and retain their period-correct styling. The movement is clean and fully functional, holding accurate time. The stainless steel case shows minor honest wear but retains sharp edges. A brand new high-end leather strap has been fitted, but all other parts are original.



Historical Significance:


While the dial is signed “Oyster” and not “Rolex,” this watch was built by Rolex during World War II under its Oyster Watch Co. sub-brand. At the time, Rolex used this name to work around wartime tariffs and import restrictions, especially in markets like the UK and Canada. These watches featured Rolex’s patented waterproof Oyster case, robust in-house movements, and overall Rolex craftsmanship—just without the Rolex branding on the dial due to legal and logistical limitations.


The serial number (364255) dates this watch to around 1944–1945, directly aligning it with the WWII period. The interior caseback is marked with reference 4453, a known Rolex case reference used for smaller Oyster models housing the Caliber 59 movement. Also inside the caseback are factory markings that read “Oyster Watch Co. Geneva–Swiss,” and “R.W.C. LTD” (Rolex Watch Company Ltd)—definitive proof of its Rolex origin.



Whether you’re a vintage Rolex collector or a fan of military-issued timepieces, this Oyster is a rare and important watch with a direct link to Rolex’s wartime production strategy. It combines historical intrigue, original craftsmanship, and robust Swiss construction—all in a compact, military-style package.



Please Note:

This watch is sold as-is in vintage condition. While it is currently running and keeping accurate time, no guarantees are made regarding long-term accuracy or water resistance due to its age.


Feel free to reach out with any questions or for additional photos. Don’t miss this opportunity to own a fascinating and historical Rolex-built military timepiece.

This elegant vintage Elgin is a wonderful example of early American wristwatch craftsmanship and a beautiful addition to any Art Deco or antique watch collection.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolco by Rolex wristwatch housed in a solid 0.800 silver cushion case. This timepiece is running smoothly, holding accurate time, and features a 28mm case size. It comes mounted on a brand new high-end black leather strap, ready for immediate wear or display.


Rolco—short for Rolex Company—was an early sub-brand created by Rolex in the 1920s and 1930s. Designed to offer the precision and reliability of Rolex at a more accessible price point, Rolco watches often shared components, movements, and finishing details with their Rolex-branded counterparts. These timepieces serve as a fascinating chapter in Rolex’s early expansion and innovation.


This example features a sharp, black sector dial with luminous Arabic numerals, a sub-seconds register at 6 o’clock, and cathedral-style hands—capturing the unmistakable elegance of 1930s design. The cushion-shaped case is constructed from solid 0.800 silver (80% silver purity), and is fully hallmarked inside with Swiss silver assay marks, including the “BREVET” patent stamp.


Key Features:

• Brand: Rolco (Rolex Company)

• Movement: Original Rolco movement

• Case Material: Solid 0.800 silver

• Case Size: 28mm (excluding crown)

• Dial: Original black sector dial with luminous numerals and sub-seconds

• Condition: Running and holding accurate time

• Strap: Brand new high-end black leather strap


This rare and authentic Rolco timepiece represents a unique opportunity for collectors and vintage enthusiasts alike to own a historically significant Rolex-associated watch.

Dunklings was a well-established jeweler in Australia, known for selling high-quality timepieces from brands such as Rolex. In the early 20th century, Rolex partnered with select retailers, including Dunklings, to offer exclusive models tailored to regional markets. These watches often featured unique designs that set them apart from standard Rolex models, making them an intriguing part of Rolex’s history and appealing to collectors.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Casio BP-1B Blood Pressure Monitor Men’s Digital Watch Module 2187 JDM
itemSummaries.shortDescription: Offered here is a rare and highly collectible vintage Casio BP-1B digital blood pressure monitor wristwatch, equipped with module 2187. Released in 2001, this was one of Casio’s most advanced health-f...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Offered here is a rare and highly collectible vintage Casio BP-1B digital blood pressure monitor wristwatch, equipped with module 2187. Released in 2001, this was one of Casio’s most advanced health-focused watches, made exclusively for the Japanese domestic market (JDM).


Unlike earlier BP models like the BP-100 (1992), the BP-1B featured enhanced health monitoring and was designed to interface via infrared (IR) with a companion calibration base unit—a unique innovation that allowed the transfer of calibration data directly to the watch, ensuring highly accurate blood pressure readings. This functionality sets it apart as one of Casio’s most ambitious and forward-thinking digital watches of its era.


Key Features:

• Model: Casio BP-1B

• Module: 2187

• Year of Release: 2001

• Functionality: Fully functional; all features including the blood pressure sensor, backlight, and sound are working perfectly

• Display: Clear digital readout with day, date, and time

• Strap: Original stainless steel band with Casio-signed clasp

• Condition: Good physical condition with light signs of use; please refer to photos for the most accurate representation

• Backlight & Sound: Fully operational

• Origin: Made in Japan – JDM-only release

• Collectibility: Rare and desirable for Casio and tech watch collectors


This is a standout piece from Casio’s health-tech legacy and a conversation-starting addition to any collection.


Ships carefully.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold cocktail watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 26mm case and original two tone dial this piece exudes unmatched classic elegance.


Rolco was a brand created by Hans Wilsdorf, the founder of Rolex, in the early 20th century as part of his strategy to expand the company’s reach and market. While Rolex focused on premium timepieces, Rolco was used for more affordable, less prestigious watches, often catering to different demographics. Some Rolco watches shared components with Rolex, including movements and cases, though they were typically of a simpler design. The brand eventually faded as Rolex solidified its reputation for luxury and phased out secondary labels.

A Brief History of the Cartier Vendome:


Introduced as part of Cartier’s golden era, the Vendome line set a new standard for minimalist elegance. Named after the Place Vendôme in Paris, a hub of luxury and refinement, this model boasts an unmistakable round case with clean lines. The early Vendome watches, such as this one, are particularly desirable for their Paris Mark 1 dials, unique features, and intricate craftsmanship. A rare first-series model, it features bronzed hands rather than the commonly seen blued hands, adding to its historical significance.

• Strap: Brand new burgundy ostrich leather band

Condition:

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a Cartier Pre-Must Stepped Tank Watch, a highly collectible piece showcasing Cartier’s iconic design from the mid-20th century. This elegant timepiece, with its stepped case and rich blue dial, represents the timeless sophistication and craftsmanship for which Cartier is celebrated. This watch is running and keeping accurate time, making it both functional and stylish for daily wear or as a collector’s item.


A Brief History of the Cartier Stepped Tank:


The Cartier Tank, first introduced in 1917, has evolved into one of the most recognizable watch designs in history. The Stepped Tank, a less commonly seen variation, incorporates layered detailing on the case for an added touch of refinement. This Pre-Must model predates the “Must de Cartier” line, offering a more exclusive appeal with vintage charm. Its design bridges the gap between early 20th-century elegance and modern aesthetics.


Key Features:

• Model: Cartier Pre-Must Stepped Tank

• Case Size: 27mm

• Case Material: 18k Gold Electroplated

• Dial: Original deep blue with Roman numeral hour markers

• Movement: Manual wind, running accurately

• Crown: Original Cartier with blue cabochon detail

• Strap: Aftermarket blue leather strap (non-Cartier, complements the dial perfectly)

• Condition: All original watch components; recently tested and holding accurate time



Feel free to reach out with any questions or to request additional photos.


This watch is being sold as-is and in vintage condition. No guarantees on future performance due to its vintage nature.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Rolco 9ct Gold Enamel Dial Men’s Art Deco Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold men’s watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 32mm unique shaped...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold men’s watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 32mm unique shaped case and original white enamel dial, this piece exudes unmatched classic elegance.


Rolco was a brand created by Hans Wilsdorf, the founder of Rolex, in the early 20th century as part of his strategy to expand the company’s reach and market. While Rolex focused on premium timepieces, Rolco was used for more affordable, less prestigious watches, often catering to different demographics. Some Rolco watches shared components with Rolex, including movements and cases, though they were typically of a simpler design. The brand eventually faded as Rolex solidified its reputation for luxury and phased out secondary labels.


Key Features:


• Brand: Rolco (Rolex)

• Case Size: 32mm (excluding crown)

• Material: 9ct Solid Gold

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound

• Functionality: Fully running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Original enamel dial with bold Arabic numerals

• Bracelet: Brand new burgundy leather strap

• Era: Circa 1920s/1930s

• Caseback: Marked with Rolex insignia, 9ct hallmark, and reference number 110669



Please feel free to ask any questions or request additional photos.


Note: This watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, with no guarantees regarding future accuracy due to its age.

Vintage Tudor By Rolex Oyster Centregraph WW2 Military Watch -Serviced & Running
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a historically significant Tudor Oyster Centregraph, a gold-plated wristwatch produced during the World War II era under Rolex’s direction. This piece represents a unique chapter in horolo...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a historically significant Tudor Oyster Centregraph, a gold-plated wristwatch produced during the World War II era under Rolex’s direction. This piece represents a unique chapter in horology, born from necessity, innovation, and wartime resourcefulness.


Background:

Tudor was established by Rolex founder Hans Wilsdorf in 1926 as a more affordable alternative to Rolex watches, offering the same robust engineering with less expensive components. During the 1940s, especially throughout World War II, Rolex faced material shortages and production constraints. In response, Wilsdorf expanded Tudor’s role in producing reliable, shock-resistant timepieces that were issued or marketed to servicemen, often built with Rolex Oyster cases for enhanced durability in harsh conditions.


This particular Tudor Oyster Centregraph exemplifies that legacy. Its design merges military functionality with the elegance of Rolex craftsmanship, making it a treasured collectible for both Rolex and military watch enthusiasts.



Key Features:

• Model: Tudor Oyster Centregraph

• Case: Original gold-plated Oyster case (approx. 29mm) marked “SWISS MADE”

• Movement: Manual wind caliber 59, clean and in working condition

• Dial: Original two-tone dial with luminous Arabic numerals and golden hands; shows beautiful vintage patina

• Crown: Screw-down Rolex Oyster crown

• Case Back: Stamped Tudor – Geneva – Switzerland – Patented, reference number 3478

• Strap: High-end brown leather strap (aftermarket)



Condition:

The watch is currently running and keeping time, though as with any vintage piece, accuracy and long-term performance cannot be guaranteed. The case and dial are in very good vintage condition with age-appropriate wear.


This is not just a watch—it’s a wearable piece of WWII history and a testament to Rolex and Tudor’s collaboration in one of the most challenging periods of the 20th century.


Ships carefully. Feel free to message me with any questions.

Vintage Casio BP-1B Blood Pressure Monitor Men’s Digital Watch Module 2187 JDM
itemSummaries.shortDescription: Offered here is a rare and highly collectible vintage Casio BP-1B digital blood pressure monitor wristwatch, equipped with module 2187. Released in 2001, this was one of Casio’s most advanced health-f...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Offered here is a rare and highly collectible vintage Casio BP-1B digital blood pressure monitor wristwatch, equipped with module 2187. Released in 2001, this was one of Casio’s most advanced health-focused watches, made exclusively for the Japanese domestic market (JDM).


Unlike earlier BP models like the BP-100 (1992), the BP-1B featured enhanced health monitoring and was designed to interface via infrared (IR) with a companion calibration base unit — a unique innovation that allowed the transfer of calibration data directly to the watch, ensuring highly accurate blood pressure readings. This functionality sets it apart as one of Casio’s most ambitious and forward-thinking digital watches of its era.


Key Features:

• Model: Casio BP-1B

• Module: 2187

• Year of Release: 2001

• Functionality: Fully functional; all features including the blood pressure sensor, backlight, and sound are working perfectly

• Display: Clear digital readout with day, date, and time

• Strap: Aftermarket

• Condition: Good physical condition with light signs of use; please refer to photos for the most accurate representation

• Backlight & Sound: Fully operational

• Origin: Made in Japan – JDM-only release

• Collectibility: Rare and desirable for Casio and tech watch collectors


This is a standout piece from Casio’s health-tech legacy and a conversation-starting addition to any collection.


Ships carefully.

Feel free to message me with any questions.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Seiko Pulse Graph PROA-4A10 JDM Men’s Digital Sports Watch – Full Set
itemSummaries.shortDescription: Offered here is an ultra rare Seiko Pulse Graph PROA-4A10, a Japan-only digital training watch released in the mid-1990s. Designed for professional athletic performance tracking, this model features r...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Offered here is an ultra rare Seiko Pulse Graph PROA-4A10, a Japan-only digital training watch released in the mid-1990s. Designed for professional athletic performance tracking, this model features real-time pulse monitoring, lap/split timing, rhythm beeps, and more—decades ahead of its time.
This set is 100% functional and includes the original Seiko box, sensor wire, multiple branded strap attachments, and original accessory kit. It’s an extremely hard-to-find full set, especially in this complete condition.
Key Details:
•Model: Seiko Pulse Graph PROA-4A10 (JDM release only)
• Module: 4A10
• Release Era: Circa 1995
•Features: Pulse sensor, lap timer, pitch beep training, result recall, timekeeping
• Original box included
• Pulse sensor wire included
•Original band included (has deteriorated but is still present)
• Several original Pulse Graph hook-and-loop strap attachments included
•Additional accessories: clip, extra gaskets, end piece, and more
• All functions are working perfectly
• Battery access via coin-style hatch for easy replacement
• Water resistant
• Made in Japan
The watch itself is in great physical condition with only minor signs of age. The original band has disintegrated, which is common for this model, but replacement straps are easy to source and fit.
Collector’s Note:
Complete Pulse Graph sets like this are extremely rare, particularly outside Japan. Whether you collect vintage Seiko, early biometric tech, or 1990s JDM rarities, this is a standout piece that rarely surfaces with all its original components intact.
Ships Worldwide.
Buy with confidence from a trusted collector. Feel free to reach out with any questions!

This vintage Rolex Dunklings telephone dial wristwatch is a classic example of early 20th-century craftsmanship. Made from 9ct solid gold, it features a distinctive 26mm case and an elegant telephone-style numeral dial. The watch is running well and holding accurate time, making it a functional piece of history. Additionally, the case back is engraved with an elegant monogram and the date 19-6-24, adding a personal touch to its rich past.



About Dunklings:


Dunklings was a well-established jeweler in Australia, known for selling high-quality timepieces from brands such as Rolex. In the early 20th century, Rolex partnered with select retailers, including Dunklings, to offer exclusive models tailored to regional markets. These watches often featured unique designs that set them apart from standard Rolex models, making them an intriguing part of Rolex’s history and appealing to collectors.

Rolco was a brand created by Hans Wilsdorf, the founder of Rolex, in the early 20th century as part of his strategy to expand the company’s reach and market. While Rolex focused on premium timepieces, Rolco was used for more affordable, less prestigious watches, often catering to different demographics. Some Rolco watches shared components with Rolex, including movements and cases, though they were typically of a simpler design. The brand eventually faded as Rolex solidified its reputation for luxury and phased out secondary labels.

itemSummaries.title: Rare Vintage German Rolex Stossicher Oyster Junior Sport WW2 Military Mens Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Oyster Watch Company (Rolex) Oyster Junior Sport from the World War II era, featuring a rare German-market “Stossicher” dial. This time...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Oyster Watch Company (Rolex) Oyster Junior Sport from the World War II era, featuring a rare German-market “Stossicher” dial. This timepiece boasts an all-original design, making it an exceptional addition for serious collectors and vintage military watch enthusiasts.


Key Features:

• Model: Oyster Junior Sport

• Movement: Original Rolex Caliber 59, 15 Rubies (shock-protected)

• Case Size: 29mm

• Crown: Appears to have been modified at some point and is no longer a screw-down, but it still functions perfectly, sits tight and flush to the case, and does not affect usability in any way

• Dial: Original dial with “STOSSICHER” (German for shock resistant) script – incredibly rare wartime variant

• Bracelet: Original stainless steel expandable stretch bracelet

• Caseback: Marked with ref. 84423 / 228CF

• Condition: The watch is running smoothly and keeping accurate time



Why This Watch Is Exceptionally Rare:


This specific example is exceptionally rare due to the “Stossicher” marking on the dial, a German word meaning shock resistant. During World War II, Rolex and its affiliated companies like the Oyster Watch Co. primarily supplied watches to Allied forces. Seeing a German-language dial variant from this era—especially with Rolex’s proprietary waterproof Oyster case—is incredibly unusual and believed to be a rare export piece to Axis-occupied territories or neutral markets like Switzerland.


The presence of “Stossicher” instead of English or French shock-resistance terms adds tremendous historical intrigue, suggesting this watch may have been targeted for sale in German-speaking regions during the wartime period. It’s a true military-era survivor, preserved with originality and character.



Condition Notes:


This watch has aged with beautiful vintage patina on the dial and hands. The original lume is intact and untouched. The movement is clean, functional, and accurate, powered by the robust Rolex Caliber 59. All parts appear correct, including the original steel Oyster case. While the crown may have been modified and no longer screws down, it sits tight and flush and does not affect performance. The original steel expansion bracelet completes the package, a rare survivor in itself.


Whether you’re a vintage Rolex collector, a military watch enthusiast, or someone who appreciates unique WWII artifacts, this Oyster Junior Sport “Stossicher” is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to own a historically significant and incredibly rare Rolex-affiliated timepiece.


Feel free to reach out with any questions or to request more photos.


Please Note: This is a vintage timepiece being sold in as-is condition. While it is currently keeping accurate time, no guarantees can be made about future timekeeping or water resistance due to its age.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Sterling Silver Art Deco Enamel Cocktail Watch With Original Box
itemSummaries.shortDescription: This beautiful antique Rolex cocktail watch is a timeless classic, ideal for watch collectors and vintage enthusiasts alike. With a distinctive design and refined craftsmanship, this piece exudes vint...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This beautiful antique Rolex cocktail watch is a timeless classic, ideal for watch collectors and vintage enthusiasts alike. With a distinctive design and refined craftsmanship, this piece exudes vintage charm and sophistication.


This particular example stands out for its unusually large 30mm case size, as most cocktail watches of the era were considerably smaller—typically around 24-26mm. The bold size combined with the exquisite enamel Roman numeral dial, featuring a striking red “XII,” adds to its visual presence and rarity.


Adding even more value and historical appeal is its original presentation box from F. Hallett, a renowned Goldsmith and Silversmith based at 28 Railway Street, Altrincham, England. F. Hallett was a respected regional jeweler during the early 20th century, known for offering high-end timepieces and jewelry, making this original packaging a meaningful piece of provenance.



Key Features:


• Brand: Rolex

• Case Size: 30mm (excluding crown) – rare large format

• Case Material: Sterling Silver (.925), hallmarked inside case back

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound – marked Rolex Swiss on movement

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Functionality: Running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Original white enamel dial with Roman numerals and ornate hands

• Crown: Original fluted crown with gilt finish

• Band: Original expandable sterling silver bracelet, marked “Sterling” and “Prov. Pat”

• Presentation Box: Original fitted F. Hallett box, lined in silk and velvet

• Era: Estimated 1920s



This Rolex represents a rare opportunity to acquire an authentic Art Deco-era piece that merges horological significance with elegant design. Its originality, uncommon size, and preserved box from a known period jeweler make it especially collectible.


Please feel free to ask any questions or request additional photos.


Note: The watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, and due to its age, no guarantees are made regarding long-term accuracy.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a vintage Casio Accelerator men’s digital sports watch, model ACL-200 with Module 1531, made for the Japan Domestic Market (JDM). Produced in the mid 1990s, this model is known for its sporty design and advanced lap memory features, making it a favorite among runners and digital watch collectors alike. This particular example comes in a rare, limited edition purple case—an eye-catching variation not commonly found.
This watch is in full working condition, with all functions—including the alarm, chronograph, backlight, and sound—operating properly. It is fitted with a brand new black resin strap, as the original strap had deteriorated with age.
The watch is in good physical condition, showing some light signs of wear consistent with age, but nothing that affects its performance or readability. The photos best represent its physical condition.
Key Details:
• Brand: Casio
• Model: ACL-200 (Accelerator Series)
• Module: 1531
• Origin: Japan Domestic Market (JDM)
• Era: Mid 1990s
• Features: Alarm, Stopwatch, Lap Memory 50, Countdown Timer, Dual Time, EL Backlight, WR 10BAR (100m)
• Case: Limited edition purple colorway
• Strap: Brand new black resin replacement
• Condition: Fully functional; good cosmetic condition
A great example of Casio’s durable and tech-forward sports watches from the mid 1990s.
Ships carefully. Feel free to message me with any questions.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Casio BP-1B Blood Pressure Monitor Men’s Digital Watch Module 2187 JDM
itemSummaries.shortDescription: Offered here is a rare and highly collectible vintage Casio BP-1B digital blood pressure monitor wristwatch, equipped with module 2187. Released in 2001, this was one of Casio’s most advanced health-f...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Offered here is a rare and highly collectible vintage Casio BP-1B digital blood pressure monitor wristwatch, equipped with module 2187. Released in 2001, this was one of Casio’s most advanced health-focused watches, made exclusively for the Japanese domestic market (JDM).


Unlike earlier BP models like the BP-100 (1992), the BP-1B featured enhanced health monitoring and was designed to interface via infrared (IR) with a companion calibration base unit—a unique innovation that allowed the transfer of calibration data directly to the watch, ensuring highly accurate blood pressure readings. This functionality sets it apart as one of Casio’s most ambitious and forward-thinking digital watches of its era.


Key Features:

• Model: Casio BP-1B

• Module: 2187

• Year of Release: 2001

• Functionality: Fully functional; all features including the blood pressure sensor, backlight, and sound are working perfectly

• Display: Clear digital readout with day, date, and time

• Strap: Original stainless steel band with Casio-signed clasp

• Condition: Good physical condition with light signs of use; please refer to photos for the most accurate representation

• Backlight & Sound: Fully operational

• Origin: Made in Japan – JDM-only release

• Collectibility: Rare and desirable for Casio and tech watch collectors


This is a standout piece from Casio’s health-tech legacy and a conversation-starting addition to any collection.


Ships carefully.

Feel free to message me with any questions.
